Generation VII.Sun: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
Generation VII.Moon: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.
Generation IX.Violet: If it loses its pincers, they'll quickly regrow. The pincers are popular ingredients in paella since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.

Generation VII.Sun: Routes 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 8 , 10 , 16 , and 17 , Secluded Shore , Poni Wilds , Poni Plains ( Berry piles )
Generation VII.Moon: Routes 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 8 , 10 , 16 , and 17 , Secluded Shore , Poni Wilds , Poni Plains ( Berry piles )
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Routes 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 8 , 10 , 16 , and 17 , Ula'ula Beach , Poni Wilds , Poni Plains ( Berry piles )
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Routes 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 8 , 10 , 16 , and 17 , Ula'ula Beach , Poni Wilds , Poni Plains ( Berry piles )

Generation IX.Scarlet: South Province: Area Five East Province: Area Two West Province: Area One , Area Two North Province: Glaseado Mountain Tera Raid Battles ( 1★ )
Generation IX.Violet: South Province: Area Five East Province: Area Two West Province: Area One , Area Two North Province: Glaseado Mountain Tera Raid Battles ( 1★ )
Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Coastal Biome , Chargestone Cavern , Polar Biome
